p: Detecting D222G/N polymorphism, monitoring the increase in circulation of variants with D222G/N mutations and studying the evolution of A(H1N1)pdm09 viruses with D222G/N mutations, especially studying transmissibility, reassortment and the effect of genetic and virological properties of the virus on the pandemic potential, are necessary for timely identification of the emergence of potential pandemic threats in the circulating population of A(H1N1)pdm2009 viruses and are of particular importance for epidemiological analysis and prognosis.
